title: The Ugandan mum who was once ashamed of her gay son
description: A support group in Uganda is helping parents come to terms with their children's sexuality.

title: Redonda: The Caribbean island transformed into an eco haven
description: After invasive rats and goats were removed from Redonda, the island's wildlife has been thriving.

title: How a bicycle tripled one woman's income
description: "You realise what a bicycle can do. It's a catalyst for unlocking so much potential."

title: Oscars 2021: 19 geeky facts from Borat to Boseman
description: Everything you need to know ahead of the 93rd Academy Awards on Sunday.

title: Are black women getting enough support for mental health?
description: Black women are more likely than white women to experience common mental health problems.

title: Could electric tattoos be the next step in body art?
description: Researchers are experimenting with thin, flexible circuits that can be transferred to the skin.

title: 'I would like Russia to be more free'
description: The BBC's Steve Rosenberg travels 2,000 miles east of Moscow to gauge the mood of ordinary Russians.

title: 'The players and I were not involved' - Klopp on Liverpool's European Super League entry
description: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp says he and his players were not involved with the club's decision to join the European Super League.

title: George Floyd death: Three Americans assess Derek Chauvin trial
description: A retired police veteran, a Minnesota resident and a black political hopeful share their thoughts.

title: Coniston Beatrix Potter farm welcomes 'rare' triplet lambs
description: It is only the third time in 18 years that a ewe at Yew Tree farm has given birth to three young.

title: Fishmongers' Hall inquest: Witness thought terrorist Usman Khan was 'play-fighting'
description: Marc Conway describes coming face to face with terrorist Usman Khan at Fishmongers' Hall in London.

title: England's 'big six' agree to join new European Super League
description: Arsenal, Chelsea, Liverpool, Manchester City, Manchester United and Tottenham are among 12 clubs who agree to join a new European Super League.

title: Coronavirus: 'Only sensible' to cancel India trip says Johnson
description: The PM's visit has been cancelled amid concerns over rising Covid cases in the country.

title: The GRU: Blast puts spotlight on shadowy Russian force
description: The role of Russia's GRU agency in a fatal 2014 explosion raises questions about its capabilities.

title: Harry Richford: East Kent NHS Trust pleads guilty over baby death
description: East Kent Hospitals Trust admits failings that came to light after family's campaign for "justice".

description: Amateur jockey Lorna Brooke dies in hospital after a fall during a race at Taunton earlier this month.

title: HSBC boss Noel Quinn scraps executive floor at London HQ
description: Bank chief Noel Quinn says the "new reality of life" is people will not be in the office five days a week.

title: Mourinho sacked by Tottenham after 17 months in charge
description: Jose Mourinho is sacked by Tottenham Hotspur after just 17 months in charge.

title: 'I want everyone to feel rugby is for them' - Monye to chair new RFU advisory group
description: Former England wing Ugo Monye hopes that as chair of a new RFU advisory group he can help everyone feel rugby "is a game for them".

title: Nasa successfully flies small helicopter on Mars
description: The Ingenuity drone completes the first powered, controlled flight by an aircraft on another world.

title: European Super League a 'grotesque concept', says Villa chief executive Purslow
description: Aston Villa chief executive Christian Purslow says the European Super League would go against everything football stands for.

title: Two men killed in Tesla car crash 'without driver' in seat
description: One victim was found in the front passenger seat and the other was in the back after the accident in Texas.

description: Two-year-old Romeo is unable to leave hospital because of his rare heart condition.

title: Young people to be reinfected with Covid for study
description: Scientists will see how the immune system copes second time round, by deliberately infecting volunteers.

description: Greater Manchester Police has warned of flouting restrictions after gathering in Platts Field Park.

description: Many papers lead with the aftermath of Prince Philip's funeral and what the Royal Family does next.

title: Election 2021: Why is turnout so low in one Hull ward?
description: People in a ward with one of the lowest election turnouts in England give their views on voting.

title: Northern Ireland: Did anyone warn about Brexit border checks?
description: Border checks have caused tension in Northern Ireland but were there warnings in the Brexit campaign?

title: Abba: Why the UK gave the Swedish band 'nul points' at Eurovision
description: Björn Ulvaeus on the Swedish band's song contest win on British soil, and the future of streaming.
